Context:
* The Green Team of the College aims to reduce the transportation carbon footprint by promoting energy efficient modes of transportation such as public transit, bicycle commuting, walking, and carpooling.
* Contact Stephanie Foster for more information about sustainable transportation initiatives.
* Walking or cycling to campus with the Activate Your Commute program is encouraged to reduce carbon footprint and environmental impacts. Bike maps are available for Casa Loma Campus, St James Campus, Waterfront Campus, and Young Centre for the Performing Arts.
* Leaving your car at home one day a week can save on gas and car maintenance, reduce stress and traffic congestion, and make a difference to the environment.
* The TTC encourages customers to make cycling a part of their transit journey.
* Contacts for George Brown College: 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559, ask.george@georgebrown.ca.
* Social media hub is available to visit.
* Information on the website is subject to change without notice and should not be viewed as a representation or warranty. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
